prs.title: Fix add and remove don
prs.truncated_body:
While calculating next DONID addDon cs was calling `LatestCCIPDon`.
If you remove the last don (n) LatestCCIPDon only gets `n-1`, and then sends expectedDonID as `n` but  the expectedDonID in Capreg is not reclaimed as `n` for newly added don, it gets added with n+1 , therefore the addDon reverts with DonIdMismatch reason.
Replacing the `LatestCCIPDon` call with `getNextDonId` call from capreg t

prs.title: op-proposer: Support multiple supervisor endpoints
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**

Adds support for multiple supervisor endpoints to op-proposer.  The selection algorithm is quite basic:
For SyncStatus, the supervisor with the lowest `MinSyncedL1` is used, ignoring any that are offline. This ensures that the wait for sync option waits for all source nodes to be in sync.  The sync status response is also used to select the block proposals are taken from, so th

commits.message: op-proposer: Use a string slice flag.
op-proposer: Rename supervisor rpc flag to be plural.

prs.title: Refactor timeout mechanism to use circuit-specific values.
prs.truncated_body: Replaced the default validator timeout constant with a circuit-specific timeout constant. This ensures the timeout behavior aligns more closely with the circuit context for improved accuracy and flexibility.

commits.message:
Refactor timeout mechanism to use circuit-specific values.

Replaced the default validator timeout constant with a circuit-specific timeout constant. This ensures the timeout behavior aligns more closely with the circuit context for improved accuracy and flexibility.

Fix import formatting in circuit.py

Removed an unused constant and adjusted formatting for clarity. This cleanup ensures better readability and aligns with code style guidelines.

Refactor CircuitEvaluationItem to use Circuit object directly

This update replaces `circuit_id` with the `Circuit` object, simplifying the handling of circuit-related data during evaluation. Removed unused imports and adjusted logic to dynamically use circuit attributes like `timeout` for better flexibility and maintainability.

Set default circuit timeout using constant fallback

Previously, the circuit timeout relied solely on the circuit's specific timeout value, potentially leading to issues if it was unavailable. This change introduces a fallback to `CRICUIT_TIMEOUT_SECONDS` to ensure consistent behavior.

Refactor `CircuitEvaluationItem` initialization logic.

Reimplemented the `__init__` method to handle legacy `circuit_id`, set default values explicitly, and initialize derived fields like `maximum_response_time`. Removed the `__post_init__` method for better clarity and streamlined attribute handling.

Merge branch 'refs/heads/release/7.2.0' into dan/refactor_timeouts

Update neuron assertions in emission tests

Revised the neuron property checks to include `uid`, `active`, `hotkey`, `emission`, and `total_stake` attributes, ensuring more comprehensive validation. Removed outdated assertions and added `print` statements for debugging during testing.

  Pull requests are ideal for making small changes to this project. However, they are NOT an appropriate venue to introducing non-trivial or breaking changes to the codebase.

commits.message: feat: mark a miner as invalid once signers have rejected its reorg attempt

test: add `mark_miner_as_invalid_if_reorg_is_rejected`

This test verifies that a signer will mark a miner as invalid if it
initially accepts a reorg from the miner, but after seeing that >30% of
other signers reject the reorg, it will mark it as invalid.

See #5820

Update mark_miner_as_invalid_if_reorg_is_rejected to use MultipleMinerTest harness

Signed-off-by: Jacinta Ferrant <jacinta@trustmachines.co>
chore: restore tests lost in merge

fix: do not return when marking current sortition as invalid

The logic for checking the current sortition should be unrelated to the
check of the latest proposal. This is a little unclear, so I added some
comments to help.

fix: re-add early exit after checking proposal

In f52dedc I had previously removed this early exit, but now I've
realized that this early exit can and should still be there, it just
needs a proper check to only exit if the current proposal is for the
current sortition which is being marked as invalid.

feat: do not allow reorg when timing is equal to allowed time

Make it strictly `<`, not `<=` the `first_proposal_burn_block_timing`.
This seems appropriate to err on the side of not allowing the reorg, and
it also makes testing easier.
chore: fix new clippy errors from 1.85

**Description**:
This PR reduces the TTL for caching fee history, gas fee, and gas price in an attempt to reduce the likelihood of INSUFFICIENT_TX_FEE errors.

We suspect that a reason that some transactions fail is because there is a fluctuation on the network gas price, while we return the cached value resulting in a too low gas estimation. By reducing the TTL in a few places where the gas fe

**Description:**
Currently, blocks are created based on a fixed number of rounds per block (default 1). This PR adds support for creating blocks based on a configurable period of consensus time. In addition, a marker file is written to disk when each block file is considered closed.
